pageContext.claim: “Another Fake Whistleblower. Republicans must do something about these terrible people, and now!”
pageContext.analysis: The whistleblower in the impeachment inquiry was not "fake" and his report on Trump's phone call proved to be largely correct. Trump is referring to Richard Bright, head of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority since 2016, is a whistleblower who says his early warnings about the coronavirus were ignored and that his reluctance to make "potentially harmful drugs" available for treating covid-19, including hydroxychloroquine touted by Trump, led to his firing. The Office of Special Counsel, investigating his dismissal, told his lawyers a preliminary assessment found there are grounds to believe he had been removed as retaliation.
